All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
Bishop
A class representing the bishop
BoardState
A class that represents what is happenign on the chessboard currently, and in general holds most of the data A constructor and the getters and setters
BoardWindow
A GUI class that represents the main playing board, what the user interacts with the most Consists of an 8x8 grid of JButtons Main functions are the actionListeners of the buttons, which notify other classes about user interaction and visualising the buttons
BotPlayer
Abstract class that all bot players (makers of PC moves) share Useful if in the future more bot players
CheckmateChecker
A class that looks at a BoardState and decides if either player is in checkmate/mate Goes through all possible moves of all pieces of each player, and if all of them end in check, checkForMate() returns true checkForCheckmate() is only called after checkForMate() and just test if a null move will still leave the player in check, and if it is then it returns true
CheckMoveControl
A class which takes possible moves of a piece and returns a list of moves which don't put the player in check The class creates a new board on which it imagines the move happening And then checks the possible moves of all enemy pieces, if any of those moves threaten the players king the move is removed
Chess
A class representing the application, used purely to call the constructor of the Controller class
Controller
The controller part of the MVC model The Overhead class which calls on all of the other classes Ensures communication between classes
Coordinates
A class that holds two integers, meant to represent positions on the chessboard The Java class Pair should work similarly, but it was not exactly what I was looking for, so I made my own
CustomGameBuilder
A GUI class the takes care of custom game setups The user is shown an 8x8 grid of JButtons, similar to the normal playing board of the BoardWindow class Then by left-clicking the board, the user can place the piece in whichever positions they want Right-clicking brings up a menu to finish the setup and begin the game Takes @Param mainMenu so it can return there after finishing the setup
FileLoader
A class capable of loading a game from a PGN file Reads the opened file character by character and based on that makes the decoded moves on a standard chessboard
FileSaver
A class capable of saving a game to a PGN file the PGNHistory class keeps a list of every move made during the game, this class simply outputs them to a file
GameRules
The Model part of the MVC model Maintains the rules of chess by keeping track of the logical parts Decides what happens on button clicks, changes turns, allows for bot player turns, requests for graphical changes from View
King
A class representing the king
Knight
A class representing the Knight
MainMenu
A GUI class representing the main menu the launches at the start of the application Here the user can choose on the specifics of the game, timer, whether to play VS the PC or not, Whether to customise the board before starting or whether to load a saved game from a PGN file Consists mainly of Java Swing elements Takes @param Controller so it then signal to start the game
NullPiece
A class representing the empty space on the board, takes no parameters holds a NONE PlayerColor and PieceType
Pawn
A class representing the Pawn
PGNHistory
After a move is made, adds the appropriate notation to its notes ArrayList
Piece
An abstract class from which all of the specific piece types inherit takes a PlayerColor @param player and sets it what all pieces inherit is the two getters, getType() and getColo()
PieceMoveGenerator
A class that when given @param board and @param coordinates returns all the possible moves that class can make Takes in consideration friendly blocking, en passant, castling etc.
PieceMover
A class which moves pieces across the board does not control for accuracy, only puts the pieces where the destination is and updates buttons Updates both the logic boards and the visual JButtons
PieceTypes
Enum listing the different types of pieces, with the NONE type for null pieces
PlayerColor
enum for player colors (or sides), with the NONE color for the null piece and a getOpposite() method
Queen
A class representing the Queen
RandomBotPlayer
A bot player which picks random pieces and makes random moves with them
Rook
A class representing the Rook
Timer
A timer running on a separate thread to the rest of the application Updates time through the System.currentTimeMillis() method Maintains the logic of the chess clock and the TimerWindow
TimerWindow
A GUI class that belongs to the Timer class, meaning it runs on a separate thread Displays the clock chess, the current turn and basic instructions Also has buttons to save/load/exit the game
View
The main class overlooking the graphical part of the program the View part of the MVC model
